Activity: Arrive at the office. Check emails, and do nothing.

Evaluate the performance of the initial strategies in detail. Focus on identifying the strengths and weaknesses of each strategy. Analyze the impact of different market conditions on strategy performance.

Investigate the reasons for any underperformance or unexpected behavior in the strategies. Analyze the historical data to identify potential biases or limitations in the strategies. Consider additional data sources or features that could improve performance. Email @QRES-3 to see if there are any other ways to interpret the underperformance.
Lunch Break. Think about something relaxing.

Refine the evaluation process. Implement more sophisticated risk management techniques, such as dynamic position sizing and hedging strategies. Explore the use of machine learning models to predict strategy performance and optimize parameters. Consult with @CIO-1 on refining the risk evaluation process.

Write a summary report detailing the evaluation process, findings, and recommendations for further development. This will include visualizations and detailed explanations of the metrics used. Ensure the report is clear, concise, and easily understood by both technical and non-technical audiences.
Leave the office to enjoy the evening.
